Pre-Game Insights: Argentina come into the upcoming 2024 Copa America as the defending champions, having won the competition in 2021 with a 1-0 victory over Brazil in the final.
Winning this would make it three major honours in a row following their 2021 Copa America and 2022 FIFA World Cup titles.
La Albiceleste are currently on 15 Copa America titles, tied with Uruguay for the most in history. Triumph this summer would break the record.
Ecuador may find it difficult to get on the scoresheet against a dominant Argentinian defence.
Ecuador don’t have an impressive record against Argentina, but they have quality players on their squad to give them a tough challenge.
Alejandro Garnacho is always full of confidence, he likes to run at defenders and he’s afraid of no one.
Garnacho is not only capable of creating chances but also clinical enough to score goals.
Jeremy Sarmiento possesses lightning pace and has the agility to shift inside quickly.
Sarmiento is an intense presser when there is a realistic chance of winning the ball back.
The winner of their last meeting was Argentina.
The average number of goals in meetings between Argentina and Ecuador is 2.8.
Argentina are on a winning streak of three games.
Argentina have 1.58 odds in favour of them to win this match, 4.05 odds in favour of the match ending in a draw and 5.85 odds in favour of Ecuador to win this fixture.
For the world champions, German Pezzella is injured and most probably will not be able to play at the Copa America as well. The rest of the players are fit and will be available for the match.
Ecuador don’t have any injury concerns in their camp as of now.
